reviews.review_text: You can t go wrong with 33. Seriously though. I recently had the pleasure of stopping in at 33 Acres Brewing after nearly a year. And I must say this place never disappoints. It was an amazing experience. The beer was incredibly delicious (as always) and the atmosphere (good music too) was super friendly and inviting. The staff at 33 are always extremely helpful and knowledgeable, always going out of their way to make sure I enjoy my time and have a good time. I would highly recommend stopping in for a pint or two if youre ever near the area as its a really great establishment. The outdoor seating is also awesome and a great way to enjoy a sunny day. Cheers!

Fantastic local brewery. Great beers, good range and all done pretty well. My favourites are the French blanche and schwarzbier but everything Ive tried has been above average. Great selection of snacks and excellent vibes.

Great beers and great outdoor patio on a quiet, tree-lined street. I would say this is the brewery with the best ambience in Mt Pleasant. WARNING: They do NOT do growler fills. If you google 33 acres growler fills the first result will tell you that they are doing growler fills, but it is not true (as of August 2023). On the FAQ of their website, they mention that they are currently not doing growler fills. Hopefully they consider doing them again - literally every other brewery in the area does.
Beautiful taproom and lovely beer. Ample seating and clear space.

Really enjoy coming here with friends. The beer menu is great (recommendation: my favourite so far is 33 Acres of Sunshine) and we love the neighbourhood vibe. Plus, for after-work gatherings, the easy snack selection makes for a good tie-over to dinner plans afterwards.

Often my first stop when traveling to Vancouver. 33Acres IPA s are a craft beer favorite and brewery snacks and food is delicious. Highly recommend their weekend brunch options. Friendly staff makes for an all around pleasant experience.

Nice brewery with a variety of beers to try out. One side has they regular beers and the other side has all their seasonal beers. They also have a patio section as well now which is new. Not much for food so it s more of a place to try different beers and not for dinner. Worth coming to for the variety of beers and atmosphere.

Went on a Sunday afternoon, lucky enough to get a table right away, cause this place is usually super busy. Tried the Tomato Avocado Benedict on waffles, it looks like a simple dish, but it tastes so good! Even the side salad is awesome! Also tired the German Pretzel, a bit on the hard side, so I wouldnt recommend it. And of course, the most important thing at this place, the beer! Love it!

As we waded through the sea of pretentious fake-fancy granola munchers who only recycle so that they can tell their endless string of two-month-long tinder girlfriends that they care about the environment as much as they care about leeching off of their west-van trust funds so that they can fill the gap that their lackluster careers leave behind, I realized it: this place is pretty great. The ambiatic tone and timber lets me know that Im in a safe place where I can sauce it up on tasty local beers, the aesthetic warms my cold heart and truly pleases my Instagram followers. Try as many beers as you can. Theyre all great. You seriously cant go wrong. Take some home. Bring your folks. Bring your friends. Bring a date. Nestle in and grab yourself a spicy sausage stick, do yourself the favour, you deserve it. Five stars.
Great beers and vibes!! The best beer we had in Vancouver   staff were really friendly and everything was clean and tidy. Being English we loved that it was order at the bar

The 33 Acres of sunshine used to be my favourite beer because its easy drinking and the 24 oz is bound to mess you up. The room is loud, there is no outdoor seating so expect to stand around if you come during the weekend. You could also buy a six pack or a growler and sit at the near by park. Their food is alright, the chacuterie doesnt come with cheese and the chicken burger was ok.
Cute place, great patio, good beer and drinks, my gin and tonics where perfect. Excellent customer service, I order some bites, no 100% sure is the place for dinner, but for drinks perfect,

West coast brewery tour continues .today s adventure takes us to 33 Acres to sit out on the patio. Top 3 tried were the 33 Acres of Darkness (Dark Lager) , 33 Acres of MKII (Mezcal Gose) and 33 Acres of MK I (Dryhopped Pilsner). Cheapest TO GO beers as well

A bit of a misnomer, there were no 33 year old bio-clock-is-ticking types for me to saddle up beside. Oh well, at least the beer is delicious and the concept is executed perfectly I guess. Turns out if you put your mind to it, hipsters will drink up your concept if you sell reigning champ swag. Make sure you wash the heavy terry crew neck at least 3 times like I washed my mouth after a swig of that belgian quad. 11.3%, yikes!
Nice atmosphere with tasty beers

My favorite brewery. Is a great place , super friendly staff , impecible interior and brand  design, amazing beer , a Slayer coffee machine and a pizza truck. Seriously great place to visit. The merchandise is on point as well. Love it.

One of my favourite Beer & Food stops. Have the Loaded breakfast sandwich on a homemade biscuit wowowowow. Today I was a little late for the breakfast so I had the Thai salad. The food didn t disappoint. Washed it all down with a little 33Acres of sunshine.

Beer is AMAZING! Mezcal gose was a very interesting surprise, might ve been my favourite. Not normally a fan of sours but really enjoyed it.  Friendly efficient service, liked it all. Highly recommend if in town
Great brunch place to go to on the weekends. I loved their avocado tomato Benny and cortado. Great place for a cup of coffee. Their beers are also on point!
Taco Thursdays are perfect! The music is right on point! It is nice to have some live music in the brewery
Very cool... very instagramy ... you have to try the Sunshine if you are a big fan of Belgian beer... annnnnd... make sure you head to the next door after this... more surprise coming!

One of the original (newer) craft breweries in the city and still one of the best. Clean lines, long tables, and a simple decor all help you focus on what youre there for -- the beer. They have fantastic items for brunch like the avocado toast or freshly-baked bread, and in the around lunch during they always have a food truck out front to satisfy any food cravings. Definitely a place to check out.

Great beer in a very personal setting. I love the self serve water taps, actually! Having sparkling and still water is amazing and truly appreciated! They also serve some light snacks & coffee, including Cartems Donuts, Ernest Ice Cream, almonds/nuts, and pretzels! It gets really busy here, especially on a nice day, but the service is always quick as its all done at the bar. Really great testing beers, I highly recommend this place!

We got two samplers, and they were huge! I liked all of them, but loved 3/4 of them. Even styles I dont usually drink. They have a nice outdoor seating area for when you want to enjoy the sun or bring your pooch.

I love this place. Between the delicious craft beer, the tasty small (and not-so-small) plates of food and the cozy but vibrant atmosphere, it makes me want to visit often. Beer is served up in 10.5oz and 24oz pours. Also fill up your growler or pick up bottles from the fridge. Kids are also welcome in the tasting room.

Great brewery and casual date spot for beers in Vancouver. Also have a great menu for light food! They are a super popular spot, so prepare to wait when visiting in the summer on a weekend. Usually a 30m wait typical weekend afternoon on warmer days.

One of my favourites. Good coffee, good beer, nice staff and super bright, minimalist aesthetic. Always my top suggestion for when friends/family wanna catch up when I m in town. Love my canvas tote bag too  I m on my 2nd one but now it s super worn out. Gonna have my mum bring me another one when she comes to visit me in Morocco!

Friendly staff who offered a taste test and a number of recommendations, a nice selection of good beer, and a number of good non-beer options including tea and snacks! The tea was a high-quality loose leaf - its nice that they put effort into the non-alcoholic options too. The place was very crowded, but the space is well used and the atmosphere is friendly.
Amazing beers. Great prices, fantastic energy, great set up. If you re ever in town this is the best place to go.
I love this place! The beers are really good, and they have lots of space on their patio. The staff is very friendly!

Perfect after lunch stop! Beer was great and had a range to fit all tastes from stouts to IPAs, even cider!. Staff very welcoming. Big bright windows, airy open space with industrial communal table, white walls & succulents everywhere-- an instagrammers delight!!
A beautiful and relaxing space with top notch beers. A favourite place to meet friends during the day or grab some beers to go and watch the sunset at Jonathan Rogers park
Great local brewery with unique beers and surprisingly good food. The actual space is very small and often busy so you may have trouble finding seating for a larger group.

This is a must go to place. Everything at 33 acres is done with purpose. From the way the beer packaging lines up when flipped either way, to the perfect branding on their coffee cups, to the clothing that they have made in Vancouver it s all done well to make a clean and awesome package. That image then meshes well with the products they offer which is crafted with the same purpose. The beer is great, the food is top notch for breweries, and the coffee is good (my preference would be for a little bit stronger of an espresso). Go here, be patient, and enjoy one of the most happening places in Vancouver.
Absolutely delicious. The 33 Ocean is immensely drinkable, and the Belgian Tripel took me back to my time in Leuven. Edit: music is about 10db too loud
Skilled in a range of beers. The fluffy clouds IPA was my favorite (Citra & El dorado). Great take out selection and prices. Very cool surf atmosphere and space
The cutest brewery ever! The beer was yummy. The only down side is it is very busy and hard to find a seat sometimes!
Really nothing to say about them: creative, delicious, cool ambience. Food could be better, but we not here for this really ;)
Clean brews! Brunch was amazing and small catch B33R was awesome.  Cafeteria red was my favorite
Top quality beers, coffee, and food in a really fun atmosphere. This places does it all so well. Loved my visit.
I love this place. Deco, people are awesome the beer is D-Beer! Just amazing!
Great beer, great location and a sexy minimal setting make 33 Acres a must for a drink at dusk. Great date place! ;)

A really delicious $8 can of beer! At these prices, you can buy exactly 250 cans of beer with $2000 CERB money. If the $8 is too much, you can ask to keep the cans, and return them for $0.05 a piece. So if you drink 250 cans, you can get back $125. FYI - Im only here because R&B opens at 2pm, they got $8 pints. Actual pints of fresh beer served in an actual glass for $8, sometimes $7.
Tasty apple cider, and great esthetics to the space. Go for a beer on the patio.

Update: I spoke with one of the managers and he was so nice and made me feel so much better. Thank you for your empathy and generosity! It made my day. On our last visit, one of the staff members made our group extremely uncomfortable. Hostile for no reason. We were so uneasy that we were hesitant to get up even to use their washrooms. As a local, it will be difficult to forget this experience. Beer is 5 stars.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Viorica, we are very sorry to hear about your experience, this is not how we want someone to leave our brewery feeling. Can you please send us an email so we can reach out to you over the phone. We d love to find out more information so we can learn how to be better. Thank you! Josh

reviews.review_text: Great beers and staff. Love the experimental side of things. Will go back one day when I m back in the city
Here is my favorite place in Vancouver. s So awooooooosome!! Beer is perfect!!! And pizza is the best. I love here:)
33 Acres Of Ocean beer is delicious!  Get the 24oz!
Perfect place for those who likes experiments! Cosy and warm, nice ambience and silent to work and have a decent conversation.

my favorite in b.c.. experimental beers are so tasty. love the cloudy ipa with the blue dots.. the dark and euphoria are excellent! definitely recommend trying. never been to the actual brewery but the neg reviews sound like standard vancouver shenanigans
Good beer

I really enjoy 33 acres beer, the service is always very engaging.. On our last visit,  we got to sit downstairs , its a nice space with great natural light. One of mine and Hubbys favourite beers there is the Mezcal Gose. Go check it out
Amazing assortment of canned beers and on tap options.

One of my all-time favourite breweries in the city! They always have a great beer selection and tasty snacks to go with it. They just opened their new patio and its perfect (especially when you want to maintain a safe distance from other people). I definitely recommend any of their sours as they never disappoint!

Right next door to their Experimental Brewery, this place follows the same pattern in offering a great atmosphere and friendly staff. After experiencing their experimental brews next door, coming over and having one of their pizzas was a delicious follow up that hit the spot just perfectly. It is no wonder this brewery has so many accolades and awards from the beer community! Highly recommend this place and would suggest you try any (and if possible, ALL their pizzas). 10/10, would recommend.
One of my favourite breweries. Love the fluffy cloud hazy ipa also their new covid patio is great
One of the best brewers in the city. The brewery is a great place to sit for a while and they have a great food menu as well as a food truck parked close by
This quality of drink and food from this craft brewery is near to the gods. A must.

Fluffy Cloud IPA forever!! Love their glasses that are the size of my head. Probably my favourite brewery in Vancouver, love coming here and would recommend for its beautiful minimalist atmosphere vibe, cute wooden patio, friendly staff, as well as being in a fun part of the neighbourhood to walk around, surrounded by murals and trees.
Well we found ET, an angry bird as well as two fish swimming beside each other.    Excellent night
Love this brewery. Often busy but ver cute vibes and 33 Acres of Sunshine is my JAM.
First time here and love it. Helpful server with recommendations for great beer. A Kolsch IPA? Oh soooo good.

We hit up 33acres experimental. This place has a cool vibe. We got 2 flights so we could try a variety of beers. They have some pretty interesting flavors and they are super good as expected. Growler fills and cans available too. We have been regulars at the original 33acres since they opened. So glad they are expanding and trying new things! Keep up the good work.

Their beer is simple, clean, and crisp. It seems like they aim to make the cleanest version of any given style and they do it well. While I enjoy and appreciate this, I generally enjoy the Experimental side more as their beer is generally more complex or interesting. When I take people to tasting rooms, this one is in my top 3. The only disappointment I ve had here is trying to get growler fills. Whatever they have on tap, my favourite never seems to be available for growler fills.
Great atmosphere. I love coming here with friends for brunch.

I really enjoy the atmosphere and decor of this particular brewery. They serve brunch on the weekend and have a handful of really reasonable options. Otherwise, they also have an assortment of food options including jerky, pizza and ice cream! They also serve coffee and tea as well, so great for a group that may have non-beer drinkings. It can get quite busy in the afternoon of a weekend and they monitor the capacity quite a bit, so just be aware of this!
Great sour in the 33 Acres of Mescal.  Very vibrant micro brewery.

Great time at 33 Acres. The beer was cheaper than anywhere else we went in that area which was awesome. We got the popcorn (soooo good) and the nuts. The nuts could have been a bit more flavorful and crunchy but overall we were impressed.

Didnt particularly enjoy my beer but that doesnt mean that this place isnt great. The dude that helped us pick was fantastic. The patio is great and the place is cool. If youre looking for a good brewery Id recommend stopping here

Very hip place with a cozy atmosphere. Beers are very tasty and offer is broad. They serves few dishes that go well with a beer (cheese plate is very tasty). Downside is, that this place can get very loud easily. If you love beer and smaller places with good vibes, this is place for you.

Continues to be one of the best local breweries with consistently excellent standard products - 33 Acres of Sunshine or California Commons anyone!  Interesting seasonal or rotating taps - we really enjoyed the Mezcal Lime Gose on a really hot afternoon!  Big, shady outdoor patio just off the hustle and noise of Main and Broadway.  Quiet leafy oasis for a refreshing beverage :-)

Great beer served up by a wonderful staff who really loves their products. The beer alone is great, but they serve up a mean pizza and wicked brunch on the weekends. Come thirsty and hungry! We always make a point to stop by as were from out of town.

Finally got in here for brunch and it blew my mind!! So good! Not at all what you would expect from a brewery... highly recommend for evening beers but also as amazing for brunch on the weekends. It does get busy as it s a small place so try to go early or prepare for a wait.

Coolest brewery in the lower mainland. Great food, solid beer options. Typically super busy but if you can get a table this is definitely an amazing spot for good times. Also serves coffee until 5pm and has other non-alcoholic beverage options. Food menu typically changes from time to time.

Get the 33 acres of Sunshine while you are here. Light refreshing crisp beer for a mildly sunny afternoon, whats more to ask for. Trendy student crowd when I visited here, wish the establishment was a much bigger size with a beer garden as that would have definitely made the experience much better. Just so you know, their beer is available at several other places too, including the Craft Beer Market.
Enjoyed the beers and the atmosphere. Will definitely be back on my next visit to Vancouver

Cute place to grab a drink with a date. They have lots of outdoor seating (picnic table style) and larger tables inside for groups. Simple and clean decor with a good bit of plants. We tried the Baby Azacca, MEZCAL GOSE and a fruity sour I think was called poppy(?) which were all great. I liked the 24oz glasses so much I had to buy two, I can t wait to use the wide glasses at home and enjoy some 33 acres bevvies.

Being from San Diego, Id like to think that I know a good IPA when I see one, and both their Nirvana (IPA) and Roam (double IPA) were fantastic, even better than many San Diego beers that Ive had. In addition, the atmosphere was very hip, they sold growlers of pretty much all of their beers, and six packs of a handful of others. The pizza that we got from the food truck that is regularly sitting outside was also very good. I ended up grabbing a growler of the Roam to take back to San Diego with me, as well as a bomber of one of their specialty aged beers.
Great beer, cool atmosphere, and awesome weekend brunch / coffee
Great little brewery, small and quaint. Very modern layout and the beer is just amazing. Top quality beer! Can t go working with the 33 acres of Sunshine. An absolute staple in Vancouver

Really enjoyed the beer and vibe here. Food truck churning out awesome smelling stone baked pizzas outside was a great touch. Small capacity, but didnt have to wait too long to get in on a warm friday evening.

The vibe of the place is even better than the beers they sell - and that s not to downplay the beers... they re great! They also have a delicious cider and occasionally have non-alcoholic kombucha available for people who aren t so into booze. They offer a few small snacks but also often have a food truck parked outside and allow you to bring in theirs goodies. Plus they have a dog tie up outside and lots of windows so you can sip on your brew and peep on your dog at the same time.
On my last visits. This place is so cool. Carter was so knowledgeable. Shaq Heather were unbelievable. Great job on service and beer. Mental is a hit.

I love this spot - always fun to try a new beer or get your fav. Brunch is amazing, super fresh and high quality. Really appreciate their outdoor seating during COVID. My one wish is that they did a meat AND cheese charcuterie board. They only have a cheese OR a meat board haha.

Favourite brewery in the city, wide array of delicious craft choices paired with a nice selection of snacks. The tasting room is on the smaller side, expect to wait a few minutes during peak hours. I can assure you its worth the wait.

My favourite brewery in the city! Beautiful decor and fantastic selection of b33r. They have two stores side by side, the one that offers their original flavors and the other with seasonal flavors. I really like their orginals but that one tends to be busier.
Fantastic brewery! Many kind of unique hint flavor mixed with bold tasty beers. Best IPA in Vancouver!! I cant tell you a word more than tasty!! They also have pizza menu what I love!!

Super cool brewery with limited seating.  We showed up on a Friday night so Im not sure if there is a wait all the time, but there was our entire time here.  The brews were very good and the food was great as well.  There was also a food truck (mexican) when we arrived but it was gone pretty soon after that, around 7 or 8pm. Staff was great and friendly and ordering was no problem.  Loved this place!

33 Acres has some super tasty beers. Ive enjoyed pretty much everything Ive had here. They also serve some food like a cheese board or pretzels and mustard. Its not like you can get a full meal here, but its something so youre not just drinking on an empty stomach. Also theres usually a food truck outside if you do get really hungry. The decor inside very clean and white.

The beer is top notch, and the food is complimentary to the beer experience. Regardless of the types of beer that you like, theres something for you here. They also have delicious ciders that vary in dryness. Overall, 33 Acres is a must visit if youre in the neighbourhood (actually, if youre not in the neighbourhood, go get in the neighbourhood, and drink some delicious beer).

This has been my #1 favourite local brewery ever since I knew about 33 Acres in 2014.  Love their beer selection, coffee and food, served by wonderful, friendly staff.  The place gets really busy starting at noon and you can tell how popular this place is!
Great beer, fantastic atmosphere and good selection of yummy eats.
Delicious beer, their Euphoria IPA is a total Knockout! Friendly staff and a chill vibe!  10/10 would visit again.
I always liked 33 Acres, but the Fluffy Cloud IPA changed the Vancouver beer scene for me. The staff remained awesome through the mandatory restrictions, and so did the general vibe.

Great little microbrewery with some fantastic beers. The Acres of Life California common is very smooth, should be a crowd pleaser. The Acres of Darkness was my favourite, its deliciously malty with a bit of coffee and toffee taste. Love it! Wish we had breweries like this in Alberta.
Great beers in a hipsterish atmosphere. Loved id
Amazing beers and atmosphere. Food is great paired with their beers as well.
Great food and fast service.  Instant fan of the ginger beer!
By far my favourite brewery in mount pleasant. The experimental location next door always has something great on tap. We definitely recommend to any beer lovers.

Cozy hang out location for beer, coffee, pizza and snacks.  The staff are very friendly and offered free samples as I was in to get a growler filled.  Seating area was filled with people working on laptops or grabbing a bite to eat, coffee shop style.  They also sell apparel, growler containers and bottles of their own beer.
